title: Charlie Puth's 'Voicenotes' is a Solid Effort
summary: The lead single off of the album, “Short Hair,” is a very catchy and fun pop track. The title track, Voicenotes, is “inspired by what [he] went through” and that “the emotions and the feelings” were his inspiration. Puth also teamed up with frequent collaborator Shawn Mendes for a song called “Change My Life” It’s a great collaboration that shows that Puth and Mendes are both on their way to becoming superstars.

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:t,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:t,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Charlie Puth has been on a roll lately, with three top 40 hits in the last two years. He\u2019s also worked with some pretty big names (including one we\u2019ll get to shortly). Now, he\u2019s back with another new album, titled \u201CVoicenotes.\u201D It\u2019s a solid effort that shows growth and maturity, as well as keeping Puth\u2019s fun and lighthearted style.
At its core, Voicenotes is an acoustic pop album. However, it goes deeper than just putting electric guitars aside; these songs are stripped right down to the bare bones. There\u2019s still plenty of production value\u2014especially on the third track\u2014but it feels like Puth made a conscious decision not to hide behind anything.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

content.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:t,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:t,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("h2",null,"Worth mentioning"),mdx("ul",null,mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},mdx("p",{parentName:"li"},"\u201CBad for Me\u201D and \u201CHow Long\u201D are two songs that Puth released in the lead up to the album, and they are both very strong tracks. Bad for Me is a bassy and groovy pop song with a killer chorus and great rhythm, while How Long is more of a ballad with a very Puth-ian piano. Both are a great taste of the album, and they are already off to a great start.")),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},mdx("p",{parentName:"li"},"Puth has said that the title track, Voicenotes, is \u201Cinspired by what ","[he]"," went through,\u201D and that \u201Cthe emotions and the feelings\u201D were his inspiration. \u201CIt\u2019s about making a change in your life. You\u2019ve got to change the way you look at things,\u201D and he truly manages to create an uplifting and inspiring track.")),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},mdx("p",{parentName:"li"},"Puth also teamed up with frequent collaborator Shawn Mendes for a song called \u201CChange My Life.\u201D It\u2019s a very catchy, bouncy pop song, and it\u2019s one of the strongest tracks on the album."))),mdx("h2",null,"Charlie Puth\u2019s growth as an artist"),mdx("p",null,"Puth has proven that he\u2019s not just a one-hit wonder, and that\u2019s always a good sign. Though he\u2019s stayed in a similar genre, and some of the songs have a similar feel, he\u2019s experimented with new sounds and new styles, while still keeping his sound. There are still strong pop hooks throughout all of these songs, but he\u2019s exploring different textures and different feels. He\u2019s growing as an artist, and it\u2019s a really nice progression to see."),mdx("p",null,"Puth also seems to be growing as a songwriter. These songs are less endearing and more mature than those on his previous two albums. The lyrics of Voicenotes are a bit darker, and they\u2019re more real. You can feel the emotion behind each song, and it feels like Puth has really put himself out there."),mdx("h2",null,"Voice Notes: Title track and lead single"),mdx("p",null,"Voicenotes is the first track on the album, and it is a beautiful and breathy acoustic pop song. Puth\u2019s voice is particularly strong here, and the chorus is an absolute banger. The lyrics are contemplative and are reminiscent of an adult journal or a letter to someone close to the writer. Puth has said that the song is intended to be a love song, and that it was written while he was in a relationship. It\u2019s a very personal song, and it\u2019s a great way to kick off the album."),mdx("p",null,"The lead single off of the album, \u201CShort Hair,\u201D is a very catchy and fun pop track. It\u2019s a bit more upbeat than many of the songs on the album, and it\u2019s a great choice for a lead single. It\u2019s a very lighthearted and fun track that is also very catchy, and it\u2019s a great introduction to Puth\u2019s latest album."),mdx("h2",null,"Nine Track Mind"),mdx("p",null,"\u201CNine Track Mind\u201D is the seventh track off of Voicenotes. It is a laid-back, chilled-out pop track with a dreamy soundscape. It has a very laid-back rhythm and texture, and Puth\u2019s breathy vocals fit perfectly with the song. The chorus is dreamy and gorgeous, and it is one of my favorite tracks off of the album."),mdx("p",null,"The title and chorus make a play on the \u201C8-track\u201D sound system that was popular in the 70s and 80s, while Puth\u2019s voice and tone are perfect for this laid-back and dreamy track. It\u2019s a very chilled-out song, and it\u2019s a great track to relax to."),mdx("h2",null,"Change My Life (ft. Shawn Mendes)"),mdx("p",null,"\u201CChange My Life\u201D is the 14th track on the album. It is a very catchy, upbeat track, with a light and airy tone. Despite the fact that it has a light tone, the track is very deep and meaningful, with Puth and Mendes singing about finding someone who can save them. It\u2019s a very sweet, meaningful track, and it\u2019s another one of my favorites on the album."),mdx("p",null,"The track is a very strong collaboration, and it\u2019s a great track that shows two artists who are both on their way to becoming superstars. It\u2019s a very catchy and lighthearted track, and it\u2019s perfect for a sunny day."),mdx("h2",null,"Mood Music (ft. Hailee Steinfeld)"),mdx("p",null,"\u201CMood Music\u201D is the 25th track on the album. It is a very dark and moody track with a very unique soundscape, and it is a very interesting track. It\u2019s a bit more experimental, and it\u2019s a very different sound from most of the rest of the album. It\u2019s a very different track, and it\u2019s one that I personally love."),mdx("p",null,"It\u2019s another track that feels very real, and it\u2019s a very interesting track that\u2019s worth listening to even if you don\u2019t usually go for this type of music. The chemistry and dynamic between Steinfeld and Puth is really interesting, and this track is a great example of the two of them working together."),mdx("h2",null,"Fool\u2019s Gold"),mdx("p",null,"\u201CFool\u2019s Gold\u201D is the 37th track on the album. It\u2019s a very smooth and groovy track, and it has a very 70s/80s pop sound, with a great bass and some fantastic percussion. It has a bit of a darker tone, but it\u2019s still a very light track, and it\u2019s very easy to listen to."),mdx("p",null,"This is another track that I really like, and it\u2019s a great way to end the album. It has great production and is a very smooth track with some fantastic instrumentation. It\u2019s a very catchy and smooth track, and it\u2019s a great track to end the album with."),mdx("h2",null,"Wrapping up"),mdx("p",null,"At the end of the day, Voicenotes is a very solid album. It\u2019s not quite a perfect album, but it\u2019s a great effort. Puth has shown growth as a songwriter, has shown creativity, and has proven that he is more than a one-hit wonder. Voicenotes is an acoustic pop album that is going to be a great addition to any playlist."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: A-Trak's 'in My Feelings' Is a Summer Bop You Need in Your Life
"Birdman" Is a Darkly Comic Meditation on Fame and Ego
"The Babadook" Is a Haunting and Original Horror Film
Bts's 'Love Yourself: Tear' Is a Triumph

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`In a world where every band is a boy band, BTS stands out. The Korean sextet has made a name for itself as not just another boy band but one that plays its own instruments and has choreographed dance routines that are so intricate they sometimes require special stage lighting.
Armed with these weapons, BTS has twice cracked the top 10 on the Billboard 200 album chart with its Love Yourself series. And the latest installment of this series \u2014 which doubles as its sixth EP \u2014 is no exception.
Furthermore, it\u2019s the strongest of the bunch.
It\u2019s impossible to talk about BTS without mentioning their massive following beyond Korea: Vivid, obsessive ARMYs (as they call them) who follow their every move and buy everything associated with them. This is why many people assume they are only famous because of social media and pandering ads (which is true). However, anyone who listens to their music will tell you that they deserve all this success. \u201CLove Yourself: Tear\u201D proves it once again.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: "The Martian" Is a Triumph of Science Fiction

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Ridley Scott\u2019s new movie, The Martian, is based on a novel of the same name by Andy Weir. It\u2019s about an astronaut called Mark Watney who gets stranded on Mars after his crewmates think he\u2019s dead and leave without him. This might seem as just another case of annoying Hollywood over-simplification: after all, we get so many bioengineered super-geniuses with computer uplink implants that they can become trapped in remote locations via their own stupidity. But there\u2019s more to it than that.
In both book and film, the humanity of Watney comes out in everything he does to survive: logical thinking (how can I eat this potato again?), ingenuity (I need water; how do I distill it from our CO2 filters), courage (explore the abandoned outpost), and compassion (contact my family). He also has a lot of fun with his predicament, cracking jokes through his video log and even going disco.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: "The Theory of Everything" Is a Touching Biopic of Stephen Hawking
"Whiplash" Is a Tense and Exhilarating Look at the World of Jazz
"The Big Short" Is a Searing Indictment of the Financial Industry

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`The film version of The Big Short hits theaters this Friday, and it\u2019s not subtle. Its tagline is \u201CThere\u2019s a sucker born every minute. But they don\u2019t grow up thinking they can be con men. They get taught to be one.\u201D And its trailer goes on to say, \u201CThe housing bubble was about to burst\u2026 And a group of misfits saw it coming. Now these unlikely heroes must band together and bring down the greedy villains who crashed the world economy\u2026 Before anyone else gets hurt.\u201D
Unfortunately, that last part is not hyperbole. The actions of unscrupulous financial engineers \u2014 colloquially known as \u201Cbankers\u201D \u2014 led directly to the Great Recession in 2008, which cost millions their jobs and homes, while triggering widespread deflation and anemic growth throughout much of the developed world for years thereafter.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: "Selma" Is a Powerful and Moving Historical Drama

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"It\u2019s been more than a century since the fight for voting rights was so prominent in American society. Films like \u201CSelma\u201D are necessary to remind viewers of this period in our history and the crucial role that certain people played in ensuring voting rights are protected. Before many others, Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr., along with other civil rights leaders, attempted to register African-Americans to vote in Selma, Alabama. It was here where police brutality and attacks on protesters were prevalent and where media attention centered around televised trials of two men accused of murdering local Black residents. The town was also home to Selma\u2019s most famous resident at the time: Collin W. Lewis, also known as \u201Cthe Lion of Selma\u201D \u2013 a prominent civil rights leader who had grown up there after his family fled Greenwood as part of the Great Migration from 1916-1921. In 1965, Lewis recruited Dr. King to come speak at Selma High School about voting rights. It was here where their partnership began and culminated in the historic march across the Edmund Pettus Bridge on March 7th, 1965 \u2013 known today as Bloody Sunday because those marching were violently attacked by law enforcement officers (including tear gas, billy clubs, and bull whips), leaving many injured and 26 hospitalized (Voting Rights Timeline)."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
